com.intel.icecp.node.management

Class ModulesImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.icecp.node.management.ModulesImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Modules

    public class ModulesImpl
extends Object
implements Modules
    Manage and run modules. The module JAR loaded by this manager must contain a MANIFEST.MF file which includes:
    • a ModuleMavenCoordinates attribute
    • a Class-Path attribute containing a space delimited list of dependency JARs
    Refer to the ModuleClassLoader docs and the sample module for more info, including its pom.xml file.

    This node sub-system is configured in "modules.json"; it uses the following properties:

    • moduleClassFilter: for limiting the search when finding Module implementations in a JAR
    • retrieveUnderMs: the time (in milliseconds) this class will wait for retrieval of dependencies
    • dependencyChannels: an array of the locations this class will for dependencies

    TODO: need to incorporate Events into this TODO: need to remove ConfigurationManager and specify configurations as parameters

                                         throws ChannelLifetimeException
        Retrieve a module JAR from the provided URI; helper method for load(Channel, String, Channel).
        Parameters:
        moduleUri - the location of the module to retrieve
        configurationUri - the location of the configuration to retrieve
        Returns:
        a future that resolves once the module is loaded and assigned an ID
        Throws:
        ChannelLifetimeException - if it fails to open the channel for retrieving the module JAR bytes

      • loadFromClass

        public ModuleInstance loadFromClass(Class<? extends Module> moduleClass)
                             throws ModuleLoadException
        Helper class for loadFromClass(Class, Attributes); it allows an in-memory module to be loaded without any bootstrap configuration applied. This method should be maintained as it may be exposed in the Modules API in the future.
        Parameters:
        moduleClass - the class of the module to load
        Returns:
        the new instance ID of the loaded class
        Throws:
        ModuleLoadException - if the module fails to load

      • start

      • stop

        public CompletableFuture<Void> stop(long id,
                                    Module.StopReason reason)
        Stop the module (assumes the module implements the stop() contract correctly). Any thread with access to the ModulePermission.ModulePermission(String, String). Investigated ways to force stop but the only sure mechanisms involve running modules in separate processes; attempted with Future.cancel() but this only works if the module respects InterruptedExceptions (and happens to sleep). And Thread.stop() is deprecated.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface Modules

      • stopAll

        public CompletableFuture<Void> stopAll(Module.StopReason reason)
        Stop all modules
        Specified by:
        stopAll in interface Modules
